author: Special Correspondent
text:
(From left) Andal of Srirangam temple, Akila (Tiruvanaikovil), and Lakshmi (Rockfort temple) leaving in trucks from Tiruchi on Wednesday to the elephant rejuvenation camp being held at Thekkampatti near Mettupalyam.PHOTOS: M. SRINATH

The elephants from three temples of Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, Sri Jambukeswarar Akilandeswari temple in Tiruvanaikovil, and Rockfort Sri Thayumanaswamy Temple left for the rejuvenation camp at Thekkampatti in Coimbatore district from here on Wednesday.

Andal from Srirangam, Akila from Tiruvanaikovil, and Lakshmi from Rockfort temple left after receiving special pooja. The elephants will be in the rejuvenation camp for 48 days.

R. Manoharan, Chief Whip in the State Assembly, P. Jayaraman, Joint Commissioner, Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department, Suresh and Jayapriya, Executive Officers of HR and CE, were present.
title: Three temple elephants leave for Thekkampatti rejuvenation camp
